thread.title: Former Monmouth star Sterling elevated to Jaguars active roster
thread.title_full: Former Monmouth star Sterling elevated to Jaguars active roster

author: app.com
title: Former Monmouth star Sterling elevated to Jaguars active roster
text:
MORE Hopefully, Neal Sterling’s passport is up to date.
Sterling, a former standout wide receiver at Monmouth University who has spent his rookie season in the NFL on the Jacksonville Jaguars’ practice squad, was elevated to the team’s 53-man roster on Tuesday afternoon.
The Belmar native and Manasquan High School graduate could see his first NFL action on Sunday when the Jaguars take on the Buffalo Bills in London at 9:30 a.m. Of the 53 players on an active roster, only 46 are allowed to dress for a game.
On May 2, Sterling became the second-ever Monmouth player to be drafted when the Jags made him the 220th overall pick in the seventh round of the NFL Draft. He was released by the Jaguars on Sept. 4, one day after catching three passes for 38 yards in his preseason debut. He had been hampered for much of the preseason with hamstring trouble, but was signed to the practice squad on Sept. 6.
The Jaguars were one of several teams Sterling met with during the pre-draft process after 19 teams showed up at Monmouth Pro Day on March 10 when he was the headliner.
Sterling closed his Monmouth career as the most-decorated Hawks wide receiver since 2006 graduate and Philadelphia Eagle Miles Austin.
Sterling finished in the top three on the career list of every receiving category. As a senior in 2014, his 16.5 yards per catch led the Big South, while his 9.1 catches per game, 905 yards and six touchdowns were all good for second in the league. His 55 catches last season were a team-high.
Sterling became Monmouth's all-time leader in receptions (212) on Nov. 15 when he caught eight passes for 136 yards and two touchdowns at then-FCS No. 1 Coastal Carolina.
Sterling joins Austin and Buffalo Bills wide receiver Chris Hogan as former Hawks on NFL rosters. Ex-Monmouth standout cornerback Tevrin Brandon is currently with the Hamilton Tiger-Cats of the Canadian Football League.
Staff writer Josh Newman: jnewman4@gannettnj.com
